Blog.post: i am a librarian. my hair has never before been long enough for a bun. it is now, and as i was too lazy for the blowout routine this morning, i shlepped it up into a bun fresh from the shower. it would seem that i need to do this more often! i have had a zillion unsolicited "lusty librarian" comments come my way already and while - mostly - this is just creepy, at long last it seems i have perfected the bun.

Everyone is making me tired. Keeping up with life takes a lot of effort, and sometimes I just want to drop out. I’m feeling really selfish right now because I really *don’t* have it so bad (although I really do have many work and social obligations that cannot be dismissed) and I think that my life would be really pleasant – if only I had the time to deal with it. For instance – I’ve recently lost a lot of weight (well, not SO recently – I’ve been working on it since October – and actually, not such a LOT of weight – but enough so that I feel a lot better about myself) and I’m forever frightened that I’ll slip back into my old body. So I have to work really hard not to let myself do this. Plus, I’m changing jobs, juggling ridiculous co-workers, keeping up with the domestic responsibilities of living with my slob-of-a-husband, and I just want to s*c*r*e*a*m ! Everyone feels this way, right? Can I just drive off into the nothing and lose myself for a little while? Am I allowed to do that? I just heard a statistic that 1 in every 100 people are schizophrenic. There may be some genetic link to this, but it is also thought to have something to do with environmental impact in childhood (and diseases and bugs, etc. you may have had as a kid). Regardless of the causes, doesn’t that statistic seem high? I meet a lot of people with mental illness in my line of work, but it still seems really high. I’m beginning to worry about my own mental state – I seem to at least display one symptom: “assigning unusual significance or meaning to normal events or holding fixed false personal beliefs”. Because, really – things are just fine.

So, my reason for creating this blog was not, in fact, to declare my love of earwigs. I actually don’t even like them very much (with the exception of that whole cerci thing). I’ve been told that I can be very negative at times. While I don’t always think this is true, I’d rather not burden my friends with my lamentations. It’s so nice to be able to express yourself – get it out there – and not have to own up to it. Doing it secretly is so much more kind. My first tirade will be about my lack of rational thought. I am like a child sometimes, wanting instant gratification, and not always thinking things through to the end. I’ve done this again just recently. I’ve interviewed for a part-time job and they’ve offered it to me. Great! Except now I’m wondering if I can actually afford not to be working full-time. I should have thought more about this ahead of time, right? hmmm…
